internal_preferencesTitle.message: Internal preferences (don't change unless you really know what you are doing)

s1.message: The following table lists and explains all preferences that are used by Adblock Plus. These preferences can be viewed and changed via

enabled-s1.message: Value of the "Enable Adblock Plus" option

frameobjects-s1.message: Value of the "Show tabs on Flash and Java" option

showinstatusbar-s1.message: Value of the "Show in status bar" option

savestats-s1.message: Value of the "Count filter hits" option

synchronizationinterval-s1.message: Unused in Adblock Plus 2.0 and higher

patternsfile-s1.message: Name of the file that should be used to store the list of filters. This can be either an absolute path, or it can be file's location relative to the user's profile.

patternsbackups-s1.message: Number of backups for patterns.ini that should be kept. If this is 0, backups will be disabled.

patternsbackupinterval-s1.message: Minimal interval between two backups of patterns.ini (in hours)

defaulttoolbaraction-s1.message: Defines the action that should be executed when the toolbar icon is clicked. Possible values are:

defaultstatusbaraction-s1.message: Defines the action that should be executed when the status bar icon is clicked. For list of possible values see

sidebar_key-s1.message: Defines the keyboard shortcut to be used to open blockable items. This preference can be empty or it can be of the form modifier1 modifier2 key. Recognized modifiers are: Shift, Accel (default accelerator key, e.g. Ctrl on Windows, Command on Mac OS X), Ctrl/Control, Alt, Meta. Key can be either a letter or a special key like F7 or RIGHT (see nsIDOMKeyEvent interface for a list of special keys).

sidebar_key-s2.message: Starting with Adblock Plus 1.3.5 multiple comma-separated shortcuts can be specified, the first available keyboard shortcut from the list will be used.

sidebar_key-s3.message: Note: This setting will only apply after the browser is restarted.

filters_key-s1.message: Defines the keyboard shortcut to be used to open Filter Preferences dialog. For description of possible values see

enable_key-s1.message: Defines the keyboard shortcut to be used to enable/disable Adblock Plus. For description of possible values see

flash_scrolltoitem-s1.message: Defines whether "Flash item's borders" in the list of blockable items should try to scroll the item into view.

previewimages-s1.message: Defines whether the tooltip in the list of blockable items should show the image that the item represents.

clearStatsOnHistoryPurge-s3.message: , clearing browsing history will also clear hit statistics for Adblock Plus filters. Note that the hit statistics often allow deducing which sites the user visited, when and how often.

composer_default-s1.message: Determines which suggestion should be selected in the filter composer by default:

sendReport_key-s1.message: Defines the keyboard shortcut to be used to send issue reports.

sendReport_key-s2.message:
For
description of possible values see

data_directory-s1.message:
The directory where Adblock Plus should store its data.  This can be either an
absolute path, or it can a directory location relative to the user's profile.
If

data_directory-s2.message:
preference is set it will override
the location for patterns.ini file while other files stay in this directory.

subscriptions_exceptionscheckbox-s2.message: , the filter list for non-intrusive ads will get special treatment and will be displayed as a checkbox in the user interface.

subscriptions_autoupdate-s1.message:
Defines whether filters in filter subscriptions will be updated
automatically.

please_kill_startup_performance-s2.message: processing filters on startup will happen synchronously and delay browser startup.

please_kill_startup_performance-s3.message: Changing this setting is not recommended but it makes it less likely that ads will appear on the first page loaded by the browser.

fastcollapse-s2.message: blocked elements will no longer be hidden.

fastcollapse-s3.message:
This might have the effect that
placeholders will show up for blocked images for example, unless hidden by other means.

fastcollapse-s4.message:
This functionality was available
as "Hide placeholders of blocked elements" before Adblock Plus 2.6.7.

currentVersion-s1.message: Stores the last used Adblock Plus version, this will trigger actions that need to be done on upgrade or first install

detachsidebar-s1.message: Stores state of the list of blockable items —

recentReports-s1.message:
JSON-encoded data on recently submitted issue reports (address of the report,
website reported and time of submission)

hideContributeButton-s2.message:
if the user chose to hide the
Contribute button.

blockableItemsSize-s1.message:
Remembered size of the Blockable Items list (width setting is only relevant when
displayed as a sidebar).

subscriptions_fallbackurl-s1.message: Address of the script that should be consulted if a subscription fails to download a certain number of times (see

subscriptions_fallbackurl-s2.message: ). %s is replaced by the address of the subscription in question. The script should print something like "301 http://example.com/new_list.txt" if the new location of the subscription is known.

subscriptions_fallbackerrors-s1.message: Sets the required number of failed subscription download attempts before the fallback script (see

subscriptions_fallbackerrors-s2.message: ) will be consulted for the new address of the subscription. Note that Adblock Plus will always retry a download one day after a failed download attempt.

subscriptions_listurl-s1.message: Address to download the complete list of filter subscriptions from.

whitelistschemes-s1.message: List of URL schemes that shouldn't be blocked (applied to both whole documents and to item locations)

documentation_link-s1.message: Address on adblockplus.org to be opened for documentation links.

documentation_link-s2.message:
It will
redirect to the actual documentation location depending on the language used.

report_submiturl-s1.message: Address on adblockplus.org to submit issue reports to.

subscriptions_exceptionsurl-s1.message: Location of the filter list used to allow non-intrusive ads.

notificationurl-s1.message: Location of the file containing emergency notifications.

subscriptions_antiadblockurl-s1.message: Location of the subscription that hides anti adblock messages.

blocklocalpages-s1.message: Unused in Adblock Plus 0.7.5 and higher

linkcheck-s1.message: Unused in Adblock Plus 0.7.5.4 and higher

checkedadblockinstalled-s1.message: Unused in Adblock Plus 1.0 and higher

hideimagemanager-s1.message: Unused in Adblock Plus 2.1 and higher

lastRuleUpdate-s1.message: Unused in Adblock Plus 2.3 and higher
